page.title: 15EMPLOYMENT-GENERAL.
page.content: The town's main industry is shipbuilding. Most of the townspeople work for Scott Lithgow shipbuilders. Near the shipbuilders there is Lamonts and Kincaids who repair the ships and provide the necessary parts. A few months ago Scott Lithgow was under threat of closure due to lack of orders and failure to complete work to contract, but fortunately the company was taken over by Trafalgar House. The collapse of shipbuilding would mean disaster for Greenock. In the East End the small shopkeepers still thrive. Their prices may be a bit higher but they are near at hand, saving the costly bus fares. The police and fire station are situated in the East End. They do not provide many jobs but do provide a very useful service.
